Check Insper Font Availability

Source: R/utils.R
check_insper_fonts.Rd

Checks if recommended Insper fonts are available (either installed locally or loaded via import_insper_fonts) and provides setup instructions if they're missing.

Usage

check_insper_fonts(verbose = TRUE)

Arguments

verbose

Logical. If TRUE, prints detailed information about font status. Default is TRUE.

Value

Invisibly returns a named logical vector indicating which fonts are available.

Details

The recommended fonts based on Insper's official template:

  • **Georgia**: System serif font for titles (primary)

  • **Inter**: Modern sans-serif font for body text (Google Font)

  • **EB Garamond**: Classical serif font for titles (fallback, Google Font)

  • **Playfair Display**: Elegant serif font for titles (alternative, Google Font)

**Two ways to use these fonts:**

**Option A - Local Installation (permanent, recommended for development):**

  1. Visit https://fonts.google.com

  2. Search for "Inter", "EB Garamond", and "Playfair Display"

  3. Download and install fonts on your system

  4. Restart R/RStudio

  5. Note: Georgia is typically pre-installed on most systems

**Option B - Remote Loading (per-session, recommended for scripts/reproducibility):**

  1. Install showtext: install.packages(c("showtext", "sysfonts"))

  2. Load fonts: import_insper_fonts()

  3. Fonts available for current R session

If fonts are unavailable, plots automatically fall back to system defaults (serif/sans).

See also

import_insper_fonts

Other utilities: format_num_br(), import_insper_fonts(), save_insper_plot(), setup_insper_fonts(), use_ragg_device()

Examples

# Check font availability
check_insper_fonts()
#> 
#> ── Insper Font Status ──
#> 
#> ! Georgia (serif) not found - will use fallbacks
#> ✖ Inter (sans-serif, body text) not found
#> ! EB Garamond (serif, title fallback) not found
#> ! Playfair Display (serif, title alternative) not found
#> 
#> ── Font Setup Needed 
#> ! Some fonts not found. Run the setup wizard:
#> setup_insper_fonts()
#> 
#> ℹ Or install manually:
#> 1. Visit <https://fonts.google.com>
#> 2. Search for: Inter, EB Garamond, and Playfair Display
#> 3. Download and install fonts on your system
#> 4. Restart R/RStudio
#> 5. Note: Georgia is typically pre-installed on most systems
#> ℹ Plots will use system fallback fonts until fonts are installed
